page.title: 17Poundsbridge Manor
page.content: Long nicknamed{"The Picture House", this old dwelling which bears the inscription 1593 WD ETA 69, was originally called "Durtnolls" and was probably built by William Dartnoll, who was Rector from 1563-1596. Edmond Woodgate died in 1678, owning "The Picture House" where he appears to have lived. In 1701 Edmond's nephew, Thomas Woodgate - a yeoman of Farningham - left to his wife, Eliza, "Durtnolls" and thirty acres near Pounds Bridge Mill and with him the male of the "Picture House" Woodgates died out. At one time the house was divided into two parts, one of which was used as an inn.
